column1: Uchi////My wife and I arrived for dinner right at the tail end of the happy hour (6:30)
column2: and we were able to sneak in a couple items from this menu. The portions for the happy hour items tend to be a lot smaller
column3: but a good deal cheaper than on the regular menu
column4: which makes this a good option for trying more dishes. We started with the uchiviche (salmon ceviche) and walu walu (oak-grilled escolar)
column5: but neither of these were particularly memorable dishes. We then had the machi cure
column6: which consisted of smoked yellowtail and served on yucca crisps (as if to resemble nachos)--flavorwise
column8: as the yellowtail had such a satisfying
